column1: #Text=California court sentences parents who kept their children in captivity

#Text=Yesterday in California 's Riverside County criminal court , Judge Bernard Schwartz sentenced David and Louise Turpin to life in prison for torturing all but the youngest of their thirteen children .
#Text=Louise Turpin David Turpin Image : State of California .
#Text=As revealed at trial , the Turpins had kept their children indoors for years and rarely allowed them outside the family home , located 70 miles ( 112 km ) south of Los Angeles .
#Text=The children were banned from washing more often than once a year and could not use the toilet .
#Text=They were severely malnourished , to the point that some of those who are now adults were initially mistaken for children .
#Text=The oldest of the Turpin 's offspring , age 29 , weighed 82 pounds ( 37 kg ) .
#Text=Another brother , 22 , was still chained to a bed when found .
#Text=None of the twelve had ever received any sort of dental care .
#Text=The judge presiding over the case , Bernard Schwartz , said , " You have severed the ability to interact and raise your children that you have created and brought into this world .

#Text= Schwartz went on to say he was not giving them the longest possible sentence because they had " accepted responsibility at an early stage in the proceeding " by pleading guilty to fourteen felony charges each and " spared your children having to relive the humiliation and the harm they endured in that house of horrors .

_	_	_	_

#Text=Specifically , both parents faced twelve counts of torture and false imprisonment , nine counts of child abuse , and seven counts of cruelty to a dependent adult .

#Text=The father said  I love my children and I believe my children love me .

_	_	_	_

#Text=The mother said  I really look forward to the day I can see them , hug them and tell them I 'm sorry .

_	_	_	_

#Text=One of the children said ,  Sometimes I still have nightmares of things that had happened such as my siblings being chained up or getting beaten .

#Text=One of them even went as far to say ,  Although it may not have been the best way of raising us , I am glad that they did because it made me the person I am today .
